intro: Waltheria americana var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular waltheria, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
